title: Mathematics 7 including Mathematics 6-7 / Mathematics 7-8 / Math Enrichment 7 / Math Interventions 7 / Math 6-7-8 Accel
subject: Math Learning Targets

document.title: Beaverton School District 7th Grade Math Learning Targets

C2BD565CA0FE4B538B5FA39D6832094C.description: AST 9.10 - Algebraic Modeling : Uses variables to represent quantities in a real-world or mathematical problems, and constructs simple equations and inequalities to solve problems by reasoning about the quantities.

B9C18CBB8AA64CC283747545B4C52ED4.description: AST 9.9 - Modeling with Rational Numbers : Solves multi-step real-life and mathematical problems posed with positive and negative rational numbers in any form using tools strategically. Applies properties of operations; converts between forms as appropriate; and assesses the reasonableness of answers.

40390CC90BC646F19595EC3FE39382E4.description: AST 9.8 - Applications of Equivalent Forms : Understands that rewriting an expression in different forms in a problem context can shed light on the problem and how the quantities in it are related.

555C657BA0234790800DD2B73B1A45EE.description: AST 9.7 - Algebraic Operations : Applies properties of operations as strategies to add, subtract, factor, and expand linear expressions with rational coefficients.

F521277DDD0742CF9AFA582F4D687A78.description: AST 9.6 - Applications : Uses proportional relationships to solve multi-step ratio and percent problems.

4EC4245755494687BC8F7AF7CF14FE74.description: AST 9.5 - Notice Proportionality : Recognizes and represents proportional relationships between quantities.

6E7F842119E340739E7D529A12177A4B.description: AST 9.4 - Unit Rates : Computes unit rate associated with ratios of fractions, including ratios of lengths, areas and other quantities measured in like or different units.

1CB4900F44554949AD36C7DA5FCB2E0C.description: AST 9.3 - Applications : Solves real-world and mathematical problems involving the four operations with rational numbers.

93A623E55A61438F8D2A7ABAF5C5D15F.description: AST 9.2 - Multiplication and Division : Applies and extends previous understandings of multiplication and division and of fractions to multiply and divide rational numbers.

98736E7D4EE24A70AC70424DAEB0AC25.description: AST 9.1 - Addition and Subtraction : Applies and extends previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers; represent addition and subtraction on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.

49DE3DC2B7EE47108696F29B1A8ABBA7.description: ALT 9 - Expressions and Equations:  Uses properties of operations, proportional relationships, and fractions to generate expressions and solve equations.

6292E470454144A6842F57B6342BB26A.description: AST 8.8 - Probability Models and Compound Events : Finds probabilities of compound events using organized lists, tables, tree diagrams, and simulations.

E29E295F5AE3438096A789A1A9CAA9B6.description: AST 8.7 - Model vs Reality : Develops a probability model and uses it to find probabilities of events. Compares probabilities from a model to observed frequencies; if the agreement is not good, explains possible sources of the discrepancy.

483CE139601E4A7FAC358E3914B27920.description: AST 8.6 - Experimental Probability : Approximates the probability of a chance event by collecting data, observing its long-run relative frequency, and predicting the approximate relative frequency.

817F3DBBCCB4482B937B28CAACE0E415.description: AST 8.5 - Interpreting Probabilities : Understands that the probability of a chance event is a number between 0 and 1 that expresses the likelihood of the event occurring.

E0F356AD7EC34D5ABE3654E51BA11B69.description: AST 8.4 - Interpreting Center and Variability : Uses measures of center and variability for numerical data from random samples to draw informal comparative inferences about two populations.

C3753F49E2D146D8A760E38694E3DA9D.description: AST 8.3 - Center and Spread : Informally assesses visual overlap of two data distributions with similar variabilities, expressing the differences between centers as a multiple of a measure of variability.

6E4C3787F5004820AF432221A5471EAE.description: AST 8.2 - Comparing Results from Random Samples : Uses data from a random sample to draw inferences about a population. Generate multiple samples (or simulated samples) of the same size to gauge the variation in estimates or predictions.

708FFE1B80FE4079A492CD4E4BF7B7D2.description: AST 8.1 - Random Sampling : Understands that statistics can be used to gain information about a population by examining a random representative sample of a population.

B25D876E3CF94D3483E2CBAC40BFFF4A.description: ALT 8 - Statistics and Probability:  Develops understanding of statistical variability and investigates chance processes to develop, use, and evaluate probability models.

7AE68C3BCF7C4C6BB72CCF4BF6A19D10.description: AST 7.6 - Volume and Surface Area : Solves real-world and mathematical problems involving area, volume, and surface area of two- and three-dimensional objects composed of triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons, cubes, and right prisms.

40A833CE1D0F45988679849AAEE5E5C0.description: AST 7.5 - Finding Angles : Uses facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles in a multi-step problem to write and solve simple equations for an unknown angle in a figure.

B605CA9EDD5541469CE11A480FEC7F74.description: AST 7.4 - Circle Area and Circumference : Knows the formulas for the area and circumference of a circle and uses them to solve problems; gives an informal derivation of the relationship between the circumference and the area of a circle.

033F45B3B2D1440AA223C93A7A331BE7.description: AST 7.3 - Slicing Solids : Describes the two-dimensional figures that result from slicing three-dimensional figures, as in plane sections of right rectangular prisms, and right rectangular pyramids.

3B32BAF69AD54EE6AF3FB3CCE3E1F114.description: AST 7.2 - Construction, Constraints and Congruence : Draws, with a variety of tools, geometric shapes with given conditions. Focus on constructing triangles from three measures of angles or sides, noticing when the conditions determine a unique triangle, more than one triangle, or no triangle.

29C69C3DDEBD435EA5171DA61A84AFF8.description: AST 7.1 - Scale Drawings : Solves problems involving scale drawings of geometric figures, including computing actual lengths and areas from a scale drawing and reproducing a scale drawing at a different scale.

CCED1620EB0F42BA8E502998A97105DE.description: ALT 7 - Geometric Figures and Measurement:  Draws, constructs, and describes geometric figures and relationships between them, and solves problems involving angle measure, area, surface area, and volume.

A56D899DC4A64DD88E7D1722E3E9EA3F.description: AST 5.6 - Volume and Surface Area : Solves real-world and mathematical problems involving area, volume, and surface area of two- and three-dimensional objects composed of triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons, cubes, and right prisms.

8326227E148A4273A30806959A24905B.description: AST 5.5 - Finding Angles : Uses facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, and adjacent angles in a multi-step problem to write and solve simple equations for an unknown angle in a figure.

C6A9AD19A71B4D61B374B99312B84F87.description: AST 5.4 - Circle Area and Circumference : Knows the formulas for the area and circumference of a circle and uses them to solve problems; gives an informal derivation of the relationship between the circumference and the area of a circle.

372DA1B868134C8C8309BAE89EFF37CC.description: AST 5.3 - Slicing Solids : Describes the two-dimensional figures that result from slicing three-dimensional figures, as in plane sections of right rectangular prisms, and right rectangular pyramids.

AAC224F105774A11A5C9305544A9B3DF.description: AST 5.2 - Construction, Constraints and Congruence : Draws, with a variety of tools, geometric shapes with given conditions. Focus on constructing triangles from three measures of angles or sides, noticing when the conditions determine a unique triangle, more than one triangle, or no triangle.

043EA877E72944409663E58D5A7E8551.description: AST 5.1 - Scale Drawings : Solves problems involving scale drawings of geometric figures, including computing actual lengths and areas from a scale drawing and reproducing a scale drawing at a different scale.

CB21611DF1004E1C9F10B226C4CE4916.description: ALT 5 - Geometric Figures and Measurement:  Draws, constructs, and describes geometric figures and relationships between them, and solves problems involving angle measure, area, surface area, and volume.

0684607239F94094AA4FC9E03D0EEAC5.description: AST 4.3 - Applications : Uses proportional relationships to solve multi-step ratio and percent problems.

D660F89FC628404C92F1FFA0272A107B.description: AST 4.2 - Notice Proportionality : Recognizes and represents proportional relationships between quantities.

5204B258DA694BACB9B14516737F470D.description: AST 4.1 - Unit Rates : Computes unit rate associated with ratios of fractions, including ratios of lengths, areas and other quantities measured in like or different units.

933A7367E50347B7B81494BCA4E31863.description: ALT 4 - Proportional Relationships:  Analyzes proportional relationships and uses them to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

3CD8A4788EDA406AB5157F8477F2D7E3.description: AST 2.4 - Algebraic Modeling : Uses variables to represent quantities in a real-world or mathematical problems, and constructs simple equations and inequalities to solve problems by reasoning about the quantities.

3ABB48DDB3F64983BBFA76C1D4EF92AB.description: AST 2.3 - Modeling with Rational Numbers : Solves multi-step real-life and mathematical problems posed with positive and negative rational numbers in any form using tools strategically. Applies properties of operations; converts between forms as appropriate; and assesses the reasonableness of answers.

A1793B8095E6461CB7AC14DA51EE6D75.description: AST 2.2 - Applications of Equivalent Forms : Understands that rewriting an expression in different forms in a problem context can shed light on the problem and how the quantities in it are related.

A6E31F074CA3421C9544364900DB9517.description: AST 2.1 - Algebraic Operations : Applies properties of operations as strategies to add, subtract, factor, and expand linear expressions with rational coefficients.

5F18F1701DCC44E5B27B55DBEE8642F5.description: ALT 2 - Expressions and Equations:  Uses properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions, and solves real-world mathematical problems using numeric and algebraic expressions and equations.

032FA5744BA34B1D8ADA1F746A2F948A.description: AST 1.3 - Applications : Solves real-world and mathematical problems involving the four operations with rational numbers.

BF505C13BED1444F82381A1DA8547907.description: AST 1.2 - Multiplication and Division : Applies and extends previous understandings of multiplication and division and of fractions to multiply and divide rational numbers.

55C570F08D07440BB975F7541493E5F6.description: AST 1.1 - Addition and Subtraction : Applies and extends previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers; represent addition and subtraction on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.

6EFBF8C5574F4F28B1C04E120877B874.description: ALT 1 - Operations with Fractions:  Applies and extends previous understandings of operations with fractions.
